In addition to its low time and space complexities, one of the main advantages of PBA compared to the state-of-the-art algorithms, e.g., TwoStack [27], DABA [27], FlatFIT [25], SlickDeque (Non-Inv) [26], and SlideSide (Non-Inv) [29], is that the latter algorithms cannot use additional threads to get performance gains, i.e., computing intermediate results in parallel.

The idea is to replace the array structure of 𝑙𝑐𝑠 buffers with a tree structure, where each leaf node stores a slice aggregation and any intermediate node stores partial aggregation of all its children (e.g., in the spirit of the array-based binary heap implementation of FlatFAT).
